text: The 2017 Malaysia FA Cup Final was the 28th final of the Malaysia FA Cup, the Malaysia football cup competition.http://www.rsssf.com/tablesm/malay2017.html Malaysia 2017 Kedah won the cup after defeating Pahang 3–2 and were assured a place for the 2018 AFC Cup group stage. == Background == The final was played on 20 May 2017 at Shah Alam Stadium. == Route to the final == === Pahang === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !Round !Opposition !Score |- |First Round |colspan=2|Bye |- |Second Round |Johor Darul Ta'zim II (a) |style="background:#BBF3BB;"| 4–2 |- |Third Round |Melaka United (h) |style="background:#BBF3BB;"| 2–0 |- |rowspan="2"|Quarter-finals |Johor Darul Ta'zim (1st leg) (h) |style="background:#BBF3BB;"| 3–1 |- |Johor Darul Ta'zim (2nd leg) (a) |style="background:#FFBBBB;"| 1–2 |- |rowspan="2"|Semi-final |Negeri Sembilan (1st leg) (h) |style="background:#BBF3BB;"| 1–0 |- |Negeri Sembilan (2nd leg) (a) |style="background:#BBF3BB;"| 2–1 |- |colspan="4" style="background-color:white"|Key: (h) = Home venue; (a) = Away venue. |} === Kedah === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !Round !Opposition !Score |- |First Round |colspan=2|Bye |- |Second Round |Kuala Lumpur (h) |style="background:#BBF3BB;"| 4–2 |- |Third Round |Perak (a) |style="background:#BBF3BB;"| 2–0 |- |rowspan="2"|Quarter-finals |PKNP (1st leg) (h) |style="background:#BBF3BB;"| 6–1 |- |PKNP (2nd leg) (a) |style="background:#FFBBBB;"| 0–1 |- |rowspan="2"|Semi-final |Terengganu (1st leg) (h) |style="background:#BBF3BB;"| 1–0 |- |Terengganu (2nd leg) (a) |style="background:#BBF3BB;"| 3–0 |- |colspan="4" style="background- color:white"|Key: (h) = Home venue; (a) = Away venue. |} == Ticket allocation == Each club received an allocation of 72,000 tickets; 32,750 tickets for Pahang, 32,750 tickets for Kedah and 6,500 tickets for purchase online. ==Rules== The final was played as a single match. If tied after regulation, extra time and, if necessary, penalty shoot-out would be used to decide the winner. ==Match== ===Details=== {| width=92% |- | | |} {| width="100%" |valign="top" width="40%"| {| style="font-size:90%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" |- !width=25| !!width=25| |- |GK ||27 || Wan Azraie |- |RB ||2 || Matthew Davies (c) |- |CB ||15 || Heo Jae-won |- |CB ||24 || Muslim Ahmad |- |LB ||14 || Faisal Rosli |- |DM ||9 || Kiko Insa || |- |RM ||26 || Mohamadou Sumareh || |- |CM ||11 || Syamim Yahya || || |- |CM ||10 || Yamil Romero |- |LM ||8 || Wan Zaharulnizam || || |- |CF ||29 || Matheus Alves |- |colspan=3|Substitutes: |- |GK ||1 || Helmi Eliza Elias |- |DF ||3 || Saiful Nizam Miswan |- |DF ||19 || Afif Amiruddin |- |MF ||6 || Christie Jayaseelan |- |MF ||17 || Joseph Kalang Tie |- |MF ||20 || Azam Azih || || |- |FW ||5 || Ashari Samsudin || || |- |colspan=3|Head Coach: |- |colspan=4| Dollah Salleh |} |valign="top" width="50%"| {| style="font-size:90%;margin:auto" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" |- !width=25| !!width=25| |- |GK ||25 || Ifwat Akmal |- |RB ||15 || Rizal Ghazali || |- |CB ||13 || Khairul Helmi (c) |- |CB ||2 || Syawal Nordin |- |LB ||3 || Fitri Omar || |- |RM ||7 || Baddrol Bakhtiar || || |- |CM ||12 || Akram Mahinan |- |CM ||8 || Liridon Krasniqi || |- |LM ||22 || Syazwan Zainon || || |- |AM ||10 || Sandro |- |CF ||9 || Ken Ilsø || || |- |colspan=3|Substitutes: |- |GK ||21 || Farhan Abu Bakar |- |DF ||17 || Syazwan Tajuddin || || |- |DF ||24 || Asri Mardzuki |- |MF ||23 || Hanif Dzahir |- |MF ||33 || Akhyar Abdul Rashid |- |FW ||14 || Fakri Saarani || || |- |FW ||20 || Syafiq Ahmad || || |- |colspan=3|Head Coach: |- |colspan=4| Nidzam Adzha |} |} {|width=100% style="font-size:90%" | Man of the Match: Baddrol Bakhtiar (Kedah) Match rules *90 minutes *30 minutes of extra time if necessary *Penalty shoot-out if scores still level *Seven named substitutes, of which up to three may be used |} ==References== Final FA Final
title: 2017 Malaysia FA Cup Final
